titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Boon Hicks, James Ivy, and Richard Ivy, Indictment
CWG6784

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Marshall Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Boon Hicks, James Ivy & Richard Ivy.

This Grand jury of Marshall County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Boon Hicks, James Ivy & Richard Ivy of the crime of Robbery committed as follows (viz) the said Boon Hicks James Ivy & Richard Ivy on the twenty sixth day of June 1865 in the county aforesaid feloniously took and carried away one rifled gun of the Value of twenty dollars the property of Frederick Wallace from the possession and in the presence of the said Frederick Wallace and against his will by putting him in fear of some immediate injury to his person, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

A Copy Attest:
C. C. Coulter clk
Bail is fixed at Five Hundred dollars for each Deft.

Commonwealth of Ky
against } Robbery
Boon Hicks
James Ivy
Richard Ivy
No. 31.
Filed in open court & bench warrant issued to McCracken. July 1. 1865

Test J. H. Riley
A. true bill
J. B. Dupriest
Foreman
Bench Wt to Graves March 13. 1866

A copy attest:
C. C. Coulter clk
